summary.p: The Kucalavarkaḷuṭaiya Katai, a prose narrative (compiled from different sources), on Kucalavaṉ, the son of Rāma and Sītā, by Rōmāpuri Cañciviṉāta-rāca-riṣi-kuru-cuvāmi (see U1, f224v6).

Margherita Trento (personal communication) pointed out that Cañciviṉātar is the Tamil name of the Jesuit Jean Venance Bouchet (1655-1732) (see Clooney 2005, p. 74). On the same or a similar work, the Kucalavaṉ Katai, see Sweetman (2012, p. 89).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (January 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on verso.
3 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Shelfmark on f[1]r.

224 folios = Kucalavarkaḷuṭaiya Katai: Text. Library foliation 1-224 on top right [taken as reference foliation for the present description]. Tamil foliation 1-72, 74-117, 119-190, 191-210, 212-217, 219-229 on top middle. Quires numbered in Tamil numerals.
7 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
the back cover. Shelfmark on verso.

decoNote.desc: Initials at the beginning of chapters. More elaborate at the beginning of an attiyāyam/adhyāya; less elaborate for sub-parts (caṟkkam/sarga) of an attiyāyam. In pākam/bhāga II, for adhyāya 13 only.

additions.desc: Title (Roman transcription) in black ink on the spine: Kouchalavâkaloudaiya Katai.
BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 339 (front cover, verso).
BnF old shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 339 (f[1]r).
In-text chapter intertitles. See e.g.: lf4r, lf6r, lf7v, lf10v, lf15v (6th adhyāya), ..., f32r (10th), f33v (1st, of 2nd bhāga), f41v (3rd), ... f52v (6th), ... f76r (12th), f81v (13th).

binding.p: Paper cover (white). Title on the spine.

origin.origDate: Internal date. See colophon (U1, f224v4). Dated to circa 1732 by Vinson (1868) and to 1732 (corrected in blue ink, by a later hand, to 1733) by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

provenance.p: Probably written in Pondicherry, by an Indian convert to Catholicism.

acquisition.p: It appears to be the histoire de Cochalaven en malabar en papier sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1733 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in an ancien list (BnF NAF 5442, f9v).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
